Evidence: Our observation that overexpression of WT APP and APP (V642I) in neurons causes an increase in APP-BP1 protein in the Triton X-100-insoluble fraction suggests that APP-BP1 protein might also be increased in AD brain in the same fraction.
Subject: p(HGNC:APP, var("p.Val642Ile"))

Evidence: Our observation that overexpression of WT APP and APP (V642I) in neurons causes an increase in APP-BP1 protein in the Triton X-100-insoluble fraction suggests that APP-BP1 protein might also be increased in AD brain in the same fraction.
Subject: p(HGNC:APP)

Evidence: Preliminary experiments identified that endogenic ATP exists in the extract and enables the neddylation reaction to modify the endogenic Cul1 with NEDD8, even without the addition of exogenic ATP or recombinant neddylation enzymes (e.g. APP-BP1 and UBA3 and UBC12) and NEDD8 itself (data not shown).
Subject: a(CHEBI:15422)

Evidence: Like ubiquitination, neddylation of CUL1 is activated through heterodimer E1 activating enzyme (APPBP1 and UBA3) and E2 conjugating (UBE2M and UBE2F) enzymes [XREF_BIBR].
Subject: p(HGNC:CUL1)

Evidence: Cullin neddylation is mediated by the Nedd8 specific APP-BP1 and Uba3 E1 activating and Ubc12 E2 conjugating enzymes and is reversible via the action of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR.
Subject: p(PFAM:PF00888)

Evidence: The NEDD8 conjugation cascade, called neddylation, is mediated by E1 NEDD8 activating enzyme (NAE1 and UBA3), E2 NEDD8 conjugating enzyme (UBC12), and E3 NEDD8 ligases, which activate and transfer NEDD8 to a target protein successively [XREF_BIBR].
Subject: a(PUBCHEM:5870)

Evidence: Our data showing colocalization of APP with APP-BP1 in lipid rafts suggest that not only APP processing but also APP signaling mediated by APP-BP1 may occur in the lipid rafts.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: The data that APP-BP1 protein is increased in lipid rafts in hippocampal neurons in AD, and that NEDD8 is translocated to the cytoplasm in this same population of neurons, suggest that elevation of APP-BP1 in lipid rafts may cause the shift in NEDD8 subcellular location.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: We have shown that APP-BP1 drives the S- to M-phase transition in dividing cells, and causes apoptosis in neurons (Chen, Y., D.L. McPhie, J. Hirschberg, and R.L. Neve.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: Overexpression of APP-BP1 in primary neurons induces apoptosis and increases DNA synthesis XREF_BIBR.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: APP-BP1 knockdown by siRNA treatment was found to inhibit the cell cycle transition into S phase, resulting in G1 phase arrest (as shown in XREF_FIG).
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: Taken together, our results suggest that APP-BP1 modulates neuronal differentiation by altering gene expression profiles in fetal neural stem cells.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: An interesting parallel comes from studies of TRIP12 in different biological settings, which showed that the ARF, BAF57, and APP-BP1 proteins are targeted for TRIP12 mediated proteolysis only when uncoupled from their physiological binding partners (;;).
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: The amyloid precursor protein binding protein APP-BP1 drives the cell cycle through the S-M checkpoint and causes apoptosis in neurons.
Subject: complex(p(HGNC:APP), p(HGNC:NAE1))

Evidence: The amyloid precursor protein binding protein APP-BP1 drives the cell cycle through the S-M checkpoint and causes apoptosis in neurons.
Subject: complex(p(HGNC:APP), p(HGNC:NAE1))

Evidence: NEDD8 is translocated to the cytoplasm in hippocampal neurons in AD brain and in cultured neurons overexpressing APP-BP1.
Subject: p(HGNC:NEDD8)

Evidence: Alzheimer's disease (AD) is the gradual loss of the cognitive function due to neuronal death. Currently no therapy is available to slow down, reverse or prevent the disease. Here we analyze the existing data in literature and hypothesize that the physiological function of the Amyloid Precursor Protein (APP) is activating the AppBp1 pathway and this function is gradually lost during the progression of AD pathogenesis.
Subject: complex(p(HGNC:APP), p(HGNC:NAE1))

Evidence: A dominant negative mutant of the NEDD8 conjugating enzyme hUbc12, which participates in the ubiquitin like pathway initiated by APP-BP1, blocks neuronal apoptosis caused by APP, APP (V642I), C31, or overexpression of APP-BP1.
Subject: p(HGNC:APP)

Evidence: We also found a moderate ubiquitous level of APP-BP1 mRNA in developing embryonic and early postnatal brains; however, APP-BP1 expression is reduced by P12, and only low levels of APP-BP1 were found in the adult brain.
Subject: p(PFAM:PF12669)

Evidence: Expression of FAD APP (V642I) in neurons causes increased expression of APP-BP1 in the Triton X-100-insoluble fraction.
Subject: p(HGNC:APP, var("p.Val642Ile"))

Evidence: These data suggest that WT APP and APP (V642I) cause the activation of cell cycle machinery and consequent apoptosis in neurons by increasing APP-BP1 levels specifically in lipid rafts.
Subject: p(HGNC:APP, var("p.Val642Ile"))

Evidence: These data suggest that WT APP and APP (V642I) cause the activation of cell cycle machinery and consequent apoptosis in neurons by increasing APP-BP1 levels specifically in lipid rafts.
Subject: p(HGNC:APP)

Evidence: These data suggest that WT or FAD APPs may initiate the apoptotic pathway at least partly by increasing the level of APP-BP1 in neurons.
Subject: p(HGNC:CTSB)

Evidence: The slight amount of AppBp1 observed may be caused by the ability of Uba3 to form dimers (XREF_BIBR).
Subject: p(HGNC:UBA3)

Evidence: These results strongly suggest that APP-BP1 modulates the cell cycle progression of fetal neural stem cells and that APP antagonistically regulates the function of APP-BP1 in cell cycle progression from G1 to S Phase.
Subject: p(HGNC:APP)

Evidence: We note that the mechanism whereby MLN4924 inhibits the NAE1 enzyme also entails stabilization of the enzyme and substrate complex, although in this instance the stabilized complex is covalent adduct 18.
Subject: a(PUBCHEM:16720766)

Evidence: Inhibition of neddylation blocks neuronal apoptosis caused not only by overexpression of APP-BP1 and APP but also by the V642I mutation of APP and by C31.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: Our results show that cell cycle progression of the cells is arrested at the G1 phase by depletion of APP-BP1, which results in a marked decrease in the proliferation of the cells.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: Conversely, the inhibition of NAE1 and APP-BP 1 expression in SQ20B cells induced p53 dependent cell death after treatment with X-rays.
Subject: p(HGNC:NAE1)

Evidence: Loss-of-function of NEDD8 activating enzyme APP-BP1 in ts41 Chinese hamster cells uncouples DNA replication and mitosis, leading to endoduplication.
Subject: p(HGNC:NEDD8)

Evidence: ASPP2 reduces the ability of NEDD8 to conjugate to Cullin-1, inhibits APP-BP1-dependent ts41 cell proliferation, and blocks the ability of APP-BP1 to cause apoptosis and to cause DNA synthesis in neurons.
Subject: p(HGNC:TP53BP2)

Evidence: As shown in A, FLAG-APP-BP1 was destabilized by coexpression of TRIP12, suggesting that APP-BP1 is a target protein for TRIP12.To test whether TRIP12 knockdown increases the stability of the APP-BP1, we generated HeLa cell lines with stable knockdown of TRIP12.
Subject: p(HGNC:TRIP12)

Evidence: As shown in B, TRIP12 directed ubiquitination of APP-BP1 in conjunction with the E1 and E2 enzymes (lanes 3 and 4), confirming that TRIP12 functions as an E3 ubiquitin ligase of APP-BP1.
Subject: p(HGNC:TRIP12)
